Getting Started

The workflow consists of three core tools. The first tool used is npm which is typically bundled with NodeJS. Npm is used only to install jspm. Once that's done you'll be using jspm's CLI and Gulp almost exclusively. The second being jspm itself and finally Gulp.

Downloading & Installing Node

This project requires NodeJS which can be downloaded here. Installation for your platform can be found on the installation wiki.

For Mac users you can alternatively install node using Homebrew as seen below. 

        $ brew install node

Installing jspm

Install jspm globally to expose the cli utility from your terminal or console. 

        $ npm install jspm -g

Cloning & Installing Project

There are a few ways you can object the project. The first is likely the easiest using the npm package manager. 

        $ npm install jspm-angular-seed

Alternatively you can clone the project using Git by running the following. 

        $ git clone https://github.com/origin1tech/jspm-angular-seed.git

Installing Project Dependencies

Run a standard npm install to install the project's dependencies by changing your current working directory to the project's path then running the npm install command. 

        $ cd jspm-angular-seed 

        $ npm install

Chrome Extension Optional

This project uses a live reload component which updates your browser automatically upon changes by listenting to sockets. To get the benefit of this you may wish to install the Chrome extenstion which makes this rather seamless (highly recommended). You can find the extenstion in the Chrome Extenstion Store.

Running Project

To run the project issue the following command from your terminal or console. This will run the live server while watching for file changes. When a file is changed you will see "Watched" along with the relevant file name. This indicates the server saw that file change and consequently issued a notify command to update your browser. 

        $ gulp serve
